1.content:
A car comes to an screeching halt in the courtyard of the X-Mansion. You find yourself being ditched out onto the gravel, along with a suitcase containing your only possessions, before the car speeds off without so much as a goodbye.

Your guardians had never been comfortable about your mutant ability to say the least, the power of -
1.title: Mutatis mutandis

choices: Ignore her, continue to your new room
Ignore her, examine the mansion first
11.content:
You started to lug your heavy suitcase towards the entrance of the Institute. After a few steps you stop and realise that you no longer have to worry about hiding your powers. You dump the suitcase and instead focus your mind on it, and after a few seconds it lifts up off the ground a few inches and hovers unsteadily forwards.

As you ascend the steps to the front door, a girl descends them. Her face remains passive but as she passes, you catch a glimpse of her thoughts.

'Oh no! Not another psychic. Is he reading my mind? Thinknotsexythoughtsthinknotsexythoughts-'
11.title: Telepathy/Telekinesis

choices: decides to help him relieve the build up
111.content:
Nodding your head, you continue up the staircase. It has been a long drive and you really don't want to deal with anybody right now. The thoughts around you are mere whispers. Closing your eyes, you slowly pulse a gentle thought around that you are nothing to have any interest in. Looking at the sheet in your hand you check the room number and open the door. The room is of a nice size and on the other side was another bunk. Shoulders sagging, you walk into the room. Scanning the room, you check where the imprint is and takes the second bed. No sense in pissing off you room mate the first day here.

Looking out the window you wish that you were back home just living his life instead of this hole. It's a nice hole. But not his home.

A gentle tingle in your mind lets you feel the approach of two people to the room and one of them was imagining flopping down on the bed you left alone. The door opens with some laugher and you look up surprised at the girls laughter. Gulping, the two girls stopped and looked at him.

"Who are you? And what are you doing in my room." Gulping you feel yourself pull into yourself, the paper falling out of your hands. Looking down she seemed to read it from where she stood. "Oh you're my roomie. Whats your power?"

Ok this place seemed like less of a hole than it did before. Blushing you tried to tear your eyes away from her. The confidence she gave off filled parts of you with an overdrive that you wanted nothing to do with. Trying to speak normally, he squeaked out. "Telepath."

"Michelle, I'm a feral." Jerking her head to the person behind her. "This is Ginette, Shes also a telepath."

Ginette Looked and Michelle. "He's good; hes sending out a cloaking thought that I am having a hard time trying to resist." Looking at him she smiiled. "Can you turn off that thought it is starting to hurt my head resisting."

Blinking you relaxed your usual defense and saw Ginette relax a bit. "Sorry. Force of habit."

"Ok I was told my new roomie was going to be another girl."

"It was suppose to be." A gentle voice said from behind. A tall woman walked into the room. "But there was no room. Until the new Dorm gets finshed he will be bunking in here." Looking at Michelle she smiled. "Blair is a recluse telepath and likes his privacy. It took five telepaths to locate him. His family died three years ago and he has been living in other peoples home ever since. We first found out about him when his mind started to change."

Blushing you felt the heat go to your toes. "I didn't mean to."

Coughing and starting to shift a bit uncomfortably she looked at you. "Yes well having to deal with the burst each time must not have been within your mental control. Many telepaths have lost a little control with it but yours had a broad effect."

Ginette looked perplexed for a bit then her eyes went wide. "He can do that in large areas?"

You felt like he wanted to crawl into a small hole deep in the earth. "I can't help it, especially when there is those pictures." You started to feel your mind starting to twitch along with other parts.

"Shit. Ginette, help me, we need to contain this burst; if not the whole campus will be effected."

Michelle looked confused. "Whats going on?"

Ginette started to rub her legs, trying to focus. "He is getting horny and his mind is projecting it out of his control." Breathing hard, she felt three teachers running to the room. "If we don't stop it, we will all be humping and fucking what ever we can."
Looking back, Michelle saw Blair trying to shrink himself into a corner repeating over and over. "I'm sorry. I'm sorry."

Walking over to you she.

Well, what works better on a girl than a man who is lost? They'll just tink you're so cute with your handsome, yet boyish looks. So you go touring the mansion looking at everything curiously. A harsh high-pitch grating sound fills your mind. You scream in pain dropping the suit case you were levitating, but not the girl. Another psychic was obviously holding her up. Whoever it was placed the girl gently on the steps. You look up the stairs a Japanese girl scolding you.

"Never use your powers like that Mister." she said outloud so that anyone who turned their attention to him thanks to scream would know he'd done something wrong. She look at the other girl with her facial expression softening at her. "hehe, Cindy I'll straighten him up real quick. You go on ahead I'll meet you at the courtyard."

And just like that her demeanor flipped the other way. The Japanese girl stabbed her finger to her chest. "More than that Cindy's my best friend, you better not be pulling anything like that again or you can bet more trouble from others too." She walked down the steps and lightly said "See you class sometime."

11511.content:
You slink away through the school to your room, avoiding eye contact, and carrying your suitcase now. You'd never been bested by a telepath before. You'd barely even met any resistance to your psychic commands before. The world had suddenly gone from being your oyster to a small academy in the back of now-where, populated by some of the world's most powerful psychics.

Coming here had been a bad idea.

You throw yourself onto the bed, and your thoughts naturally turn to revenge. With a broad smirk, you consider making the Japanese girl think she's a dog and letting her loose on the grounds.

'My ears are burning,' the girl's smug voice suddenly rang clear in your mind. 'You wouldn't be thinking about me now, would you?'

12.content:
You lug your heavy suitcase towards the entrance of the Institute, straining against the weight of all your worldly possessions, and then you realise that you no longer have to be concerned about hiding your powers from public. Relaxing your mental hold on your mutant power, you allow your biceps and triceps to swell dramatically. You look odd with your disproportionately muscled arms, but you're able to lift your suitcase with ease and it feels good to finally use your powers openly.

You ascend the steps and enter the Institute. There's a richly decorated foyer with a staircase leading up to what you guess are the dormitories. You dig into a pocket and find your room key, with room number attached.
12.title: Metamorphosis

121.content:
So many people. Your head burns as it processes the many, many different faces and body shapes, storing them away for later use. Your body wavers uncertainly like it's in a heat haze, half adopting one or two characteristics from each new person that you lay your eyes on.

You almost miss your quiet homelife, and you're certainly grateful when you push open the room to your door and find it quiet and empty. You lay on the bed and feel bits of your brain buzzing away; the unsettling, unguided metamorphosis of your body slows and returns to default.

Just as it does, you hear a knock at the door.
121.title: Go to your room

12111.content:
The door opens with enough force to suggest the opener is more accustomed to kicking them down. Into your room walks a sullen, young woman and behind her a equally sullen man. There's a strong resemblance between the two. They must be father and daughter, you decide. Cut the hair and add a couple of amazing sideburns, and she'd probably be a dead ringer.

She stares at you with distaste. "A shapeshifter," she spits.

The older man gives her an encouraging pat/push on the back, propelling her into the room and towards the second bed. "Look at this as training. You got your own mystique training-dummy."

She continues to stare and sniffs pointedly. "He smells funny, Logan."

Logan almost looks proud. "See, you're learning already. All shapeshifter's do. The nose never lies." He leaves, with a "see ya around, kiddo."

The door closes. The girl doesn't take her eyes off you for a second.

"Hi," you venture.

12111222.title: Saved by the Wolverine (well sort of)

12112.content:
The door opens and a teenaged girl enters the room, pretty with long brown hair and wearing a yellow school like outfit you've seen some of the more mature students and teachers occasionally wear. When she speaks her voice is American but you get the impression she has some Jewish roots from her features.

"Oh! You must be the new roomie of mine. Nice to meet you, I'm Katherine Pryde, but you can call me Kitty if you'd like." Her hand stretches out to your and you shake it warmly.

Still, you are a little confused. "Um, so we're room mates? But you're a-"

"Girl? Well no duh. Its is true though - normally the Professor likes us to pair up with the same gender, but we're kind of busy right now so we made an exception in this case. No worries about privacy though - we have seperate bedrooms and all, we just share everything else right? Oh, and I'll promise not to be snoopy and all that." At an confused look from you she laughs. "Oh of course - you don't know my powers? Well I can phase through stuff like walls and floors. Really useful for sneaking about but gives you a heck of a bad rep when you start off." She sighs. "Course I've been here for a good year now so thats mostly past. So what's your power?"

You decide to be honest enough. "Metamorphsis."

"Ohhh, we have another shapeshifter! Shapeshifters are always handy round here." She glances about, as if looking for someone who might be listening in. "Listen, I know the guide said we're not allowed pets but... well something happened and I kind of became a special case, so I hope you don't mind sharing with Lockheed."

You nod warmly, expecting her to bring in a cat or dog from her room as you watch amazed as she simply phases through the door to her room. But that amazment is tripled when she brings out a squaking, one foor purple creature which you can only describe as like a baby dragon. "What the heck...?"

"Oh, this is Lockheed. Don't worry, he's house trained. Well admitively I had to clean up some nasty carpet burns when I first got him from the Nega-" she trails off slightly... "Um, I mean from... er, China! Yeah, China... So anyway, he's very well behaved. Say hello Lockheed." The purple dragon leans over her shoulder to look at you before speaking some weird language which is so not Chinese. Kitty seems to understand the phase though and frowns. "Now thats a bit rude. Just because he's new doesn't mean he's an idiot Lockheed." The creature speaks again, a little more humbly. "Thats better, I think."

Putting Lockheed down on the sofa she turns back to you and smiles warmly. "So classes don't start for you till tomorrow and I've volunteered to show you round for the day. What would you like to see first?"

You smile back, thinking that you're going to enjoy the beautiful and friendly company of Kitty Pryde.
12112.title: Meeting Kitty

choices: Stick with Kitty, Kurt and Rachel to the Danger Room.
Head up to the Pool with Alex, Betsy and Bobby.
121121.content:
Seeing as you're going to be studying inside for the next few years of your life you might as well check out the mansion's facilities first, so Kitty and you start to look around, thankfully leaving that slightly freaky purple dragon of her's behind. One day you'll get the real story on where Lockheed comes from, you're be sure of that.

After about half an hour you're already starting to like this place. Not to mention the fact that you're surrounded by fellow mutants and people who don't want to hang you or destroy you, like that loonie Reverend Stryker keeps pouring out on the Television about how bad you guys are, though he generally uses the equally crazy example of the Brotherhood, some terrorist group who don't think that Mutants and Humans can co-exist and strive to be rid of the latter, a sentiment you worry ever once in a while you agree with considering the slack you've had to deal with at times.

In any case the mansion is awesome. A large set of living rooms with huge TVs and comfy sofas, a couple of kitchens where a sizable set of snacks and meals are on stand by with a number of soft drinks too. "No beer, unfortunately for poor Logan." Kitty laughs. "He's the clawed gruff guy you might have seen around. Don't let it fool you though - he's a really great guy, at times he's kind of been like a older brother I never had." You find that hard to believe given what you've seen of the Logan fellow already, but Kitty is one of the older teens and knows her stuff.

The classrooms are divided nicely, with both Professor Xavier and a number of adult Mutants, said to have been the Professor's first generation of students, including Scott Summers, (known as 'Cyclops thanks to his laser blasting eyes), Jean Grey, (an attractive red head with telepathic abilities which you bemoan inwardly has some long standing friendship with Summers - looks like even Mutant schools have hot, unattainable teachers as well), Onoro Moroe, (known as 'Storm' for her weather powers, a tall Amazon like woman with striking white hair) Hank McCoy, (a blue furrish fellow who is the brainy fellow in the bunch despite his appearance and codename as a 'Beast') and Emma Frost (a slightly creepy white blonde woman, also with mental abilities and is a stunner in attraction, if perhaps a little cold - her last name suits her you'd reckon). Kitty is also seen to swoon at a handsome Russian man who she tells you is named Piotr Rasputin and is able to turn his body into steel, giving him the name 'Colossus'. Like you and Jean Grey, he appears to be the unattainable teacher in her life, which worries you slightly as you do find her quite attractive yourself.

Of course you also meet a couple of Kitty's friends of her own age - Betsy Baddock, aka 'Psylocke', a purple haired girl of British origin with telekensis powers and apparently according to Kitty, 'Ninja kind-of stuff', Bobby Drake aka 'Iceman' with your typical snow and ice related abilities, 'Nightcrawler' aka Kurt Wagner, another blue mutant from Germany and who has the power to teleport about the place, and Rachel Grey (for whom you do a double take at with her last name and her oddly familar face, though Kitty doesn't mention any relation to Jean) who has telepathic powers as well and the codename 'Marvel Girl' (though she much prefers Rachel). Someone who is related to someone you've already met is Alex, the younger brother of Scott Summers, and who appears to have the powers of energy blasts too, though from his hands rather than his eyes, giving him the codename 'Havok'.

Kitty mentions that there are tons of other students and the like dotted about the school but knows she doesn't want to otherwhelm you. In any case she says that she is heading off to a place called the 'Danger Room' with both Rachel and Kurt and invites you to tag along. On the other hand Bobby, Betsy and Alex are going to the pool and say you can come as well if you'd like. You'd quite like to keep tagging with Kitty, plus Rachel and Kurt seem like nice people, but then the Danger Room hardly seems like the nicest place to be, certainly compared to a pool visit. Perhaps you could get to know Betsy better and maybe anyone else who will be at the pool.
121121.title: Friends and Allies

choices: Agree with Rachel, opt for some Sentinel destruction.
Go with Kurt, try battling some of the Brotherhood.
1211211.content:
Whilst the Danger Room doesn't exactly sound like the greatest place for relaxation you admit to a certain curiousity as to what exactly it is, and the chance to spend more time with the delightful Kitty Pryde, not to mention Rachel Grey and Kurt Wagner does appeal to you.

The trio of mutants take you to a lift where Kitty punches in a few buttons and the lift descends down to the basement level, which you gather to be the super top secret part of the mansion and where many of the older members of Xavier's students get to go. Even so, it appears that Kitty is able to give you a sneak peek of the place already. You don't linger too much on your trip to the so-called 'Danger Room' though you spot signs mentioning a hanger (for what? They have a plane here and if so, where the heck does it take off from?) medical bay, armoury, suiting room and something called 'Cerebro' which you could only guess to be something really fancy and complicated. You decide to avoid asking questions for now - Kitty and the gang probably wouldn't tell you anyway, not to mention the fact that you're convinced that when the time is right, you'll know everything.

At last you reach a set of double doors in a steel hallway bearing the words 'Danger Room' in enbolded letters upon the metalic door way. Kitty gives you a warm grin. "Ok, we're here. This is the Danger Room. Since mutants need to be ready for any sort of crisis or emergency, the Professor and Hank created this machine for us to train in. Kind of think of it as like the Holodeck on that dorky sci-fi show-"

"Hey!" Kurt speaks up. "Star Trek is not dorky! Its decent viewing and you know it, mein fruenden!" You find it odd to think that an blue furrish man who can teleport would find a science fiction show so appealing but to be honest you're seen weirder stuff than that already.

"Well, in any case the Danger Room is way cooler. We can use it to recreate any sort of situation we want to and try and combat it. Since its all a simulation we won't get killed and it helps us work better as a team."

You glance at the door in amazement. "So you could have anything happen in there?"

"Yep. Since you're new and I'm interested to see how your powers work out, I'm going to program in an easyish simulation for us to do as a team. Rachel, you got any preferences?"

The red head speaks up for the first time. "Well I could do with some practice against Sentinels. You can never have enough Robots blowing up."

Kurt strokes his chin. "In mein own case, Kitty, I'd quite like some fighting against the Brotherhood. We can never be too careful when it comes to underestimating them."

Kitty looks between the pair of friends before deciding that you'll have the final say. You've heard of both groups of course - enemies of Professor Xavier on both sides of the fence. Sentinels happen to be huge purple robots, varying from a mere twelve foot to over fifty, creations of those humans who would seek to destroy all of mutantkind. The Brotherhood on the other hand are mutants, except unlike Xavier they are equally determined as the Sentinels to be rid of mutants. Led by the mysterious Magneto, so-called 'Master of Magnetism' due to his powers of malipulation of metals, and with an assortment of allies at his call, the Brotherhood are a dangerous threat, so it wouldn't hurt to be ready for both of them.

Question is, which one to start with? Sentinels or Brotherhood?

Your body parts from you and you can hear the slightest movement. Something’s coming back to me, you think to yourself as something touches you. You turn with great speed and stare the two terrified men in the eyes. They back off and head for the exit. The only exit. Now you’ve got to stop them before the lock clicks back. Their stumbling over themselves as they quickly insert the key. You walk slowly, the moment of getting there in time no longer matters to you. You had no intension of killing anyone. Your hand is on the back of the man’s shoulder, he turns to you, his eyes grow wide, he opens his mouth to speak but nothing comes out. “Move” you say to them and grab the door. It breaks under your pressure and shatters in pieces on the hard floor. You walk out of the room and see staff members running toward you with restraints in both directions and your powers began to overtake you once more...

(Written by jessi_2003)
1233111.title: You hear a key in the lock

12331111.content:
A smile winds its way over your face as you walked down the corridor. You felt your body slowly warp into something new, and feared. Your eyes gazed back towards the smoldering floor, damaged by your foot steps.
"What am I?" You whispered to yourself as you gaze down at your smooth white and black skin like armor. You felt your tail swing out to reduce the walls around you to rubble.

You listened to the bullet ring out, ad gazed towards the bullet as it melted before you. Without a word, you gazed up towards the men with a smile as they watched their weapons melt into liquid like blubbles that floated up into oblivion.
"Jesus! Run!" You heared one of them say as they ran through a huge door.

You felt the power seep out of you. Your hand reached up to your burning mind as your DNA shiftd back. Your eyes gazed down painfully to your skin.

Back to normal.

"What... was that?" You muttered as you rubbed your temples. You felt weak, like it had zapped all your energy. Your feet wobbled forward as you tried to maintain balance. You listened to the voices approaching

(Written by Gex)
12331111.title: Keep going

choices: Forget the message and try to find a way out
Stop and try to figure out how to use your power
1233112.content:
Without personal memories you have no way to determine why you're being held in a concrete cube with no vents, no windows and no company, but you have enough general knowledge to realize that wherever you are, it's no standard prison. Whatever this place is, it seems unlikely that you'll be afforded legal representation, let alone parole for good behavior. If you're to have any chance at freedom, all signs indicate that you're going to need to make it yourself. The only question is how exactly to do that.

By all appearances, the room is so absurdly secure that not even air could escape, never mind a 220-pound convict. But you also know the room can't possibly maintain both complete isolation and survivable homeostasis, not with a living inmate mucking up the works with all that cellular respiration. And that meant renewal. Whether it was changing the oxygen, disposing of waste or just delivering meals, it had to be possible to take things into and out of this room—and that would be your chance to escape. Since the only means of entry into the concrete cube seemed to be the large steel door recessed into one wall, all signs pointed to hand-delivery. This in mind, and with no idea how long it would be until the next delivery, you immediately set to work preparing your escape.

The first thing you do is turn on the taps of your simple wash-basin, using your socks to clog the drainage hole. This is the step of your plan that will take the longest, so it's important that you get it underway while you finish your other preparations. Next, using tooth and nail you rip into the simple mattress in a display of primitive savagery to make any Neanderthal proud. What this maneuver lacks in dignity it more than reclaims in efficacy and in minutes you have exposed the coiled metal springs within. Again using the strength of your jaw to accomplish what your fingers cannot, you painfully wrench the steel wire form its frame. It's exhausting and damaging work, but after several hours and a mouth full of bloody cuts and gashes you finally have what you're trying for: several lengths of stiff steel wire, each about the length of your forearm. After twisting these segments together the result is a heavy, durable cylinder of metal about the length and diameter of a crowbar. Another few hours grinding one end of the bar against the rough concrete of the walls and floor and you have fashioned the most popular tool in human history—a pointy bit of metal suitable for stabbing things. Breaking off one of the bed's legs and fastening your tool to the end, you manage to upgrade it to an even deadlier version: an improvised spear.

By now, the water from tap has done exactly as you'd hoped. Since the room is completely airtight, it is by definition also watertight, and the water from the basin has filled the tiny concrete cube nearly up to your waist. Clutching your spear in one hand and holding yourself to the toilet with the other, you launch the most insidious phase of your plan yet—you wait.

Eventually, though, your patience pays off. There is a click in the door as someone on the other side disengages the elaborate locking mechanism—followed immediately by a startled scream. As soon as the heavy steel door begins to slide upward into the ceiling the water flooding the room begins to rush through the resulting opening, sweeping the unfortunate guard and his two compatriots off of their feet. Releasing your hold on the toilet you let the water carry you with superhuman speed toward the opening, driving your spear into fallen men one after another as they try in vain to regain their footing. As the blood of your captors spreads, cloudlike through the clear water, it strikes you that you ought to be horrified at what you've done—but somehow you get the feeling that these are not the first to have lost their lives attempting to control you, nor will they likely be the last. Besides, you have more important things to worry about right now than the proper emotional response to a violent jailbreak—namely, completing said jailbreak.

Taking stock of your new surroundings, you realize that you're still not totally free—the area immediately outside your room seems to be some kind of airlock. This room, however, contains something your cell lacked: keys. Taking them from the still-bleeding corpse of one of your would-be jailers, you soon have the second door unlocked and have emerged into the hallway proper. By now alarms are blaring, the angry wail of klaxons overlaid with a businesslike female voice over the loudspeakers.

"Warning: there has been a containment breech in sector D! I repeat, containment breech in sector D! Full facility lockdown to take immediate effect! The use of lethal force is authorized!"

Well, that wasn't good. Clutching your spear tightly, you make off down the hallway, hoping to stay one step ahead of the inevitable armed response. As you run, the woman on the loudspeaker continues.

"All personnel—Keep in mind that the subject can assume any shape! If anything—no matter how innocuous—looks out of place, respond with extreme prejudice. The same applies to any person caught without escort who fails lockdown identification procedures. Remain with your fire teams at all times, and do not break company for any reason! All authorized commands will come over this channel and this channel only. Disregard any instructions delivered in person or by radio—they are not legitimate, and almost certainly an attempt by the subject to confuse and mislead you!"

What in the world? What did she mean, 'subject can assume any shape?' People couldn't do that—could they? No, certainly not. The very idea was… well, it was absurd. If you wanted to escape, you'd have to do it the old-fashioned way. Of course, with every mention of fire teams and lockdown procedures, that seemed less and less likely…

(Written by Scipio Africanus)
1233112.title: Try to find a way to escape

choices: Try to reach the air vent
Try those shapeshifting powers you heard about
12331121.content:
You ignore the warning and continue your escape, hoping that you could find a way out before someone finds you and uses something that you can't stop with a spear - like a gun. Continuing on, for a while, the halls are quiet besides the blaring siren, and cold, probably due in part to your lack of socks. You turn a corner and stop dead. There is a guard about 5 steps in front of you, smoking a cigarette and facing away from you. Thinking there is no reason to kill an innocent man who isn't trying to kill you, you bash him in the back of the head with the handle of the spear.
*THUMP!*
The man falls to the floor, unconscious, and begins to bleed slightly. You think there may be a chance of him dieing, but, valuing your own life more than his, you move on.

-------------About 5 minutes later---------------------

You find a door out of the building, and quickly realize why there were so few guards before. It looked like every single guard (Besides the one you knocked out, of course) is stationed at one of the doors out of the building. You counted 15 guards at the door, and guessed that there were probably that many at every other door out of the building.
While concentrating on the guards, you had completely ignored your surroundings and subsequently banged your hand into a vase as you pulled back. It fell and shattered, and you heard the guards fall instantly silent. You started sweating, realizing that you had very little time before the guards sent a patrol. You notice an air vent above you, but don't know if you can reach it in time. You think quickly and come to a snap decision. You...
12331121.title: Forget the message and try to find a way out

choices: Grab your spear and attack the guard
Try to convince him you're really a guard
123311212.content:
You look again and decide you could never reach the vent in time, let alone quietly, and charging the guards would be absolute suicide. So, for lack of a better plan, you decide to try those shapeshifting powers you heard about. You concentrate on looking exactly like the lead guard at the entrance, and wait.
A few seconds later, you feel a tingling all over your body, and your vision goes black. For a second that feels to you like an hour, you fear that you were actually stabbed from behind and died. then your vision returned and the first thing you noticed was that you were wearing a mask like the one that all on-duty guards seemed to wear, then noticed the rest of yourself.
You had lost your old shape, and had donned the exact guise of the lead guard. You were close to 6 feet tall, and seemed fairly fit, and your armor had the red shoulder stripe of the squad leaders. Then you noticed 2 other things. One was that you were still holding the spear from before, and not the sleek and deadly black magnum carried by the leaders. The other thing you noticed was that you couldn't remove the suit. At first you thought that it was stuck, and that you would need to shapeshift to get it off, then you realized something. You had never seen the lead guard without their armor, so maybe that was why you couldn't remove the suit.

You think about changing the person below the suit into yourself (the only person you had already been), but discarded the idea when you heard the guards coming. Thinking quickly, you throw your spear below the table the vase used to be on and changed into the guard who you had knocked out. There was the blackness from before, then you regained vision and walked towards the guards.
"What are you doing walking around during a lockdown?" The leader asked when you entered his view.
"I thought I saw him and came to get backup." You said, and instantly regretted it.
The leader tensed as sensors alerted him to a voice match to your voice. Your voice! You had never heard him talk, so you couldn't copy his vocal patterns.
"Solder," The leader said as he turned off his sensors to keep from being near-deafened each time you spoke, "why does your voice sound identical to that of the prisoner?"
You thought fast and came up with a decision. You...
123311212.title: Try those shapeshifting powers you heard about

choices: Pretend to be the lead guard (You got his voice, and his magnum is right there).
1233112121.content:
Adrenaline kicks in as you devise your plan, and you find that shapeshifter adrenaline seems to be supercharged.
You lash out and grab your spear, and stab the leader before his mind even registers what happened. He falls, and the other guards reach for their pistols, all in slow motion. You swing the spear as hard as you can at the next guard. You hear a solid *CLANG*, and you injure your hand, but the guard flies through the air to the left, taking out another guard. By this time, the other guards had raised their pistols and aimed at you. Thinking fast, you change you left arm into a basic square of steel about 6 inches thick, and are surprised to find it weighs almost nothing to you. Bullets fly at you from two pistols, and you deflect them. By this time, the rear guard out of the two had started to edge away, giving you a perfect opportunity to hit him. You throw your spear like a javelin, putting your defenses down for only a second, before pulling them back up. It impaled him right through the heart, killing him and splattering blood over the back of his partner.
You decided to finish it there, and smashed the other guards with your metal plate of and arm, mixing the clanging of metal and the cracking of ribs. You change back to normal, look at the people on the floor, and throw up. After a minute, you realize the ten guards at the door will wonder where the guards are. You decide to...
1233112121.title: Grab your spear and attack the guard

choices: Stay with the guard squad until the lockdown is canceled.
12331121211.content:
You change into the lead guard, and double check to see that your voice changed too. After finding that it worked, you look below his helmet to find out what he looked like and get a jolt as you realized something. You have a non-shapeshifting skill that will be very useful - a photographic memory, perfect for your power. You get a good look at the face of the guard, grab his sleek black magnum, stashing one of the standard black repeater pistols carried by non-leader guards in your armor in case, then hide his body. You check over everything, then go to the squad of guards to try and trick them.

The secondary leader - with the blue stripe on his shoulder and the (slightly) better repeater with five extra shots per clip and a larger caliber as proof - greets you as you return.
"What was it sir?" He asked, probably hoping to go home.
"It was the shapeshifter," you respond, "He attacked with a makeshift spear, killed my squad, and got away before I could catch him."
"What did he look like?" One guard asked.
"A minute ago," you told him, "he looked like a guard private, but sounded like himself, setting off my sensors."
You gave yourself a mental pat on the back for figuring out the rank of the guard on such short notice, as the others talked.
"He must have made up the form," the second in command said, "or he would have sounded like the guard, right?"
"It makes sense." One guard said.
You realized that the guards would remain here until two days from now or later unless you were found, so you decided to...
12331121211.title: Acting the lead

choices: A guard from a different squad, dragging the body of the real lead guard!
An alarm indicating the lockdown was over
123311212111.content:
You mentally sighed as you realized you would have to stay with the guards until the lockdown was up. There was no way even you could kill ten guards uninjured. So, once more without a plan, you decide to stay put and stay with the guards until you either had a very good chance to leave, the lockdown ends, or someone catches on. You begin thinking of ways of dodging questions while at the same time getting info on the lead guard even as you turn towards the hall...

----------------1 week later (by your count)-----------------

A week later, you had found the name of the guard, Kevin, the various ranks of the guards, the basic layout of the facility (no name for it, not even prison or compound or anything), and that Kevin was the strongest of the guards in the squad. Thus far, very little had happened, minus the daily supply run for food and ammo. Everyday was the same; waiting for an enemy you knew would never come. One day (2 days after you arrived with the guards, or 9 days from before the week skip), you heard something. Listening, you realized it was...

(Written by E)
123311212111.title: Lingering

choices: Try to convince the guards you're the real one
1233112121111.content:
You hear a set of footsteps, and what sounds like a dragging sound, coming from around the corner. You look around the corner and feel like you're having a heart attack. Coming towards you from around the corner is a guard. The guard doesn't worry you, it's what they're carrying that scares you.
They're dragging the body of the real lead guard behind them.
They noticed you and walked towards your squad, body in tow, and began to remove they're mask to give identification.
"Sir," She said to the second in command when she got close, "I found this body hidden in a closet nearby and was wondering if-"
She stopped as she noticed you, then dropped the body and aimed her repeater pistol at your head.
"What is the meaning of this?!" The second in command yelled at her as you backed into a wall, repeater close enough for you to get a good look at the black bullet at the back of the barrel of the gun.
"This is the same person as that body over there!" She shouted as loud as she could, giving a shock to the other guards.
"What?! Are you sure?" One asked from the back of the crowd, looking at you with an extremely nervous glance.
"Look at both below the helmet and see for yourself." She responded, sounding angry that they didn't believe her right away.
After a quick comparison, and lots of debating, the second in command turns to you, obviously nervous.
"Do you have anything to say to try to deny this, sir?" He asked, eying you, hand on his repeater pistol.
You decide to...

(By E)
1233112121111.title: Evidence?

choices: The shapeshifter finds his way out/all the guards but Ellen and Sirius are fired
The shapeshifter finds his way out/all the guards but Ellen and Sirius are kille
12331121211112.content:
That shapeshifter adrenaline is powerful stuff.
"No." You gave him simply, before changing into a puddle before his eyes. One guard looked like he was going to throw up, the others looked extremely scared.
"Fire at will!" The second in command yelled, before all of the guards began shooting at you with all they had, doing absolutely nothing.
"Catch it!" The women who brought the body yelled. You, deciding that staying long enough for them to get a bucket was a bad idea, shot away as fast as you could. They managed to find a rusty bucket just as you reached the door, and each and every one of them paled realizing that you were going to get away. The second in command and the woman seemed to be the only ones with the ability to move. The second in command dashed towards the door faster than you expected he could even move, while the woman grabbed the bucket from a paralyzed guard and followed suit. Getting outside, you went for the first manhole you could see, just as the doors burst open and the two guards that could move dived out towards you. Just as the women slammed down the bucket to catch you, you finished going down the manhole and changed into yourself again. With no planned destination, you ran in the direction that had the most light.

---------------------------------------Meanwhile---------------------------- --------------------

Sirius sighed, and looked to the women, who was looking, extremely sadly, into the rusty bucket. He walked over, ignoring the strange looks from the 70 or so people in the square.
"We should get back inside, before people start getting curious." He said in a very sullen tone.
"Right." The women said, depression plain in her voice. The two of them, their black suits standing out in the sunny summer's day, walked in and closed the door.
"By the way," Sirius asked, realizing he had never gotten her name. "Who are you?"
"Ellen," She said, barely holding back tears. "not that it matters now that I'm going to lose my job."
Sirius frowned, realizing there was little chance of them keeping their jobs now. Thinking about it, he realized that there was very little chance of the team of guards keeping their jobs from the moment they failed to identify the shapeshifter. He sighed, this was a good job too. Very little happened, but they got paid to keep coming to work every day and chatting. It was only when things happened that the job was at all bad.
They arrived at the group and, after telling them what had happened, they all went to the office of the boss. They went through the normal procedures, having two people do fingerprint and retinal scans, then answering 5 questions each. When they finished, they opened the door to find the boss, unlike every other time they had ever seen him, standing about 2-3 steps from his favorite chair. He smiled as they all entered and spoke in the icy, cruel voice they all knew well.
"Welcome, I was expecting you."

(Written by E)
12331121211112.title: Lash out

choices: The owner of the house lets you stay/Sirius and Ellen go on a training mission
The owner of the house doesn't let you stay/Sirius and Ellen go after you
123311212111121.content:
"Everyone but the second in command and the women, you're fired." The boss said, using his voice that gave the message "Reject my orders, you die."
They all mumbled sadly, then took off their Armour and went on their way. Sirius stood, surprised, as the boss turned to the two of them.
"You two," He said, obviously addressing Sirius and Ellen. "do you want to keep working here?"
"Sir, yes sir!" They both responded in sync, as though you had practiced it a hundred times or more.
"You two are about to be transferred to my special retrieval squad, do you understand?" He said.
"Sir, yes sir!"
The squad was only a rumor to the normal guards. No one who went to it was supposed to talk about it. Of course, Sirius reminisced, some had decided that rule was unimportant, then would disappear the day after they talked about it.
"Go to the armory, then type the code 96E212 into the panel next to the steel door at the back, and choose armour and weapons from the racks. The captain down there will tell you the rules after you arrive." He said with a grim tone.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

You smiled as you arrived at a sewer exit and saw it was still light out. You walked over, cut it open with an arm the shape of a sword (scaring a couple, who promptly ran home and agreed it was their imagination), and walked into the light for the first time you could remember (second if you counted the escape). Walking along, you realized you had nothing to eat, drink, and no place to stay. You walked around, enjoying the sights, copying some clothes you saw, and enjoyed yourself until it got dark. Stopping, you looked for a hotel. It took around an hour to find a place, then you reaized you had no money. By this time it was really dark, and you were about to give up and change into something small, maybe a fly, when you heard a voice from the other side of the street.
"Ready to pay up?"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

Sirius gaped at all the things here, and realized why the squad was so secret and exclusive. He looked quickly, settling on a light yet durable looking suit of high-tech armour. He quickly looked through the weapons, remembering the rules the captain had given him.
"One primary weapon, a max of two pistols or other small weapons, five grenades of your choice, and a suit of armour, this stuff ain't cheap, so be careful." He remembered the words exactly. He grabbed an assault rifle, a revolver like those of the first in commands, a repeater, and five fragmentation grenades. He looked over the weapons and armour as he grabbed spare ammo, and admired the black color of every item in the room, perfect for stealth missions.
"What do you think?" Sirius heard Ellen yell over. He looked and saw her wearing a skin-tight black suit that had a small camera on the back of the helmet.
"What does it do?" He yelled back, having learned by attempt that every item in the room did more than would be expected.
"A few things," She said as she walked over to him. "It's waterproof, has an inner temperature control, and can take a picture from the back of the helmet and project it to the front, making the wearer invisible from the front, so long as they stay still."
Sirius whistled as the implications set in. just from her words, he guessed she had a sniper on her, and sure enough, she was holding a sleek black rifle with a high-powered scope, a folding thermal camera, and about five clips of extra ammo. On each hip she had a black Sub Machine Gun with laser sights in case she needed to precision target. She was wearing a belt with three flash bang grenades and two fragmentation grenades. She smiled as she saw what Sirius had chosen. Typical solder, she thought as she looked at the assault rifle with laser sight, the suit that looked quite a bit like a standard guard outfit, and the black repeater. She was surprised to see the detachable bayonet on the assault rifle, and the revolver he was carrying, but figured a bit of a more straightforward attack was his style.
"What does yours do?" She asked, gesturing to the suit he was wearing.
"It acts quite a bit like a standard guard suit," He said. "except that it's more flexible and has an experimental energy shielding."
She looked it over in mild interest until she heard a sharp order from the captain.
"Listen up, here's your first job..."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------

"Hello?" You said, as a gang of around 25 came out of the shadows and surrounded you.
"Give us all your money!" Said the one you assumed was the leader.
He was around 5 foot 3 inches, and was louder than the various people who surrounded him and, also, who were taller and stronger than him.
"I have no money," You said, a bit more quickly than you intended. "so leave me alone."
The leader just sneered at you, then yelled to his huge men, "Get him!"
You sighed, you didn't feel like fighting these losers, yet, you felt even less like getting harassed for awhile by constant gang attacks. Deciding what to do quickly, you turned yourself into a living man of solid steel.
"Stand back," You warned. "and I promise not to hurt you."
about half of the men ran right there, and the eyes of the leader seemed to bug out, but the remaining men stood their ground.
"Suit yourself" You said as you charged them.

-----a little less than 5 minutes later-----

After thoroughly beating up the men, you decided to look for a place to stay. After looking, rather unsuccessfully for a nice, quiet place that no one would guess, you reached a small yet cozy house and decided to see if you could stay.
"Besides," You thought as you knocked. "what's the worst that could happen?"

(Written by E)
123311212111121.title: Nice toys

12331122.content:
Wait, shapeshifting? But that's impossible!" With that, you're about to dismiss the possibility when it dawns upon you that it may be the only way out of a heavily guarded prison facility filled with hundreds of guards. Suddenly, this shapeshifting thing seems a whole lot more interesting, even possible! You wonder how you can use these powers, but as you try to mentally push a lot of buttons with great force, you quickly find the right one. You see a guard walk up to you, and before he can shoot you you stab him through the head, but not before hearing "Ugh! It's that....that....THING!" This makes you so furious, so angry you want to burn this entire place down!

That thought seems to have triggered your ability, as with that thought a dizzying wave rushes over your body, and you can feel pores enlarging while at the same time you seem to grow millions of tiny organs that produce an endless stream of fire. Before long you've turned into a living man of flames, and you're giving off immense heat. Oddly enough, you don't seem to be harmed by it yourself! Unbelievingly, you wave your arms back an forth a few times, almost as if you're trying to shake off the flames, but they cling to your body like skin. Shortly after you take your first few steps, the heat you produce triggers a fire alert, and you're doused with hundreds of litres of water from massive ceiling vents. You're immediately extinguished, and you reflexively change shape after the thought "Oh god, I don't want to drown, I want to get out of here!". You have now changed shape into:
12331122.title: Stop and try to figure out how to use your power

1233121.content:
A few minutes later you were pelting it across the country side, wailing sirens and the bark of dogs at your back. Wow, that was easy. And yet crazy dramatic. To think that you'd escaped the most fortified research facility in the world with little more than your wits and a spork.

Still, your adventure wasn't over. The possibility of recapture is close at your back. And ahead is..
1233121.title: You escape. That was easy!

12331211.content:
The world around you barely registers as you make your escape, your bare feet being cut over and over by the sticks and sharp rocks of the ground. The enormity of the situation suddenly hits you with a vengeance as you see a sharp and high cliff looming directly in front of you, coming up fast. Your body is running on sheer momentum at this point, leaving you unable to stop. A single gunshot, fired from behind you, reminds you that you can't turn back the way you came either, even if you could. A lone voice calls out.

"Guys! It's over here! We've got it cornered over by the cliff! All units close in!"

Men in black body armor and carrying large guns come pouring out of the foliage. Your only option is to jump off the cliff. It's tragic, but you can't stop now. With a mighty leap, you go over the edge, your spirit soaring with thoughts of your final hope and the cold wind whipping at your face on the way down. Only one thought goes through your mind before you black out:

"No matter what happens, I want to survive this! I want to survive!"

To Be Continued...

(By Belgium EO)
12331211.title: Perilous cliff

1233122.content:
Begining to pace like a caged tiger ,her feet making slight slapping sounds on the cold tiled floor,she searched her swiss cheese memory for any hope in hell of recalling why she was here,where here was and how to get the hell out of here.

The longer she paced the more she became aware of a faint tingling feeling that had begun to race along her veins and her muscles tensed when she caught sight of herself in the two way mirror above the small sink..seeing not the young woman whom had been in this room a few seconds ago but a face with black stripes marring the ever growing orangey red fur that was sprouting from her very pores.

Her body shifted slightly and she looked down to find that all the curves that she was proud of had turned to sleekly toned feline muscle and fur,strong legs and sharply curved claws poking from the tips of small toes,and a sinous tail lashed the recirculated air lazily behind her ..well..behind.

JESUS H CHRIST!!!!

The thought tore through her mind as she blinked huge amber eyes and a raspy tongue darted out to lick her feline chops,her whiskers trembling with the action even as a growling sound centered in her belly told her that she was hungry..no..not hungry,she was starving!

A low clicking noise alerted her to the fact that someone was unlocking that damnable door and her head swung around to face it.
1233122.title: Tigers and lions and shapeshifters,oh my!

124.content:
A group of girls cross the foyer, banishing any thoughts of just retiring to your room from your head. They're all beautiful - athletic bodies squeezed into figure-hugging latex, some of them with exotic, even animal-like appearences. One girl with pointed pixie-ears and amazing rainbow-coloured wings smiles at you as she skips by.

You find yourself absent-mindedly drifting after them, your luggage forgotten. You suddenly decide to use your powers to...
124.title: Play with your power

125.content: You actually had several power of which metamorphosis was just one, the others included: elemental control over fire, water and sometimes air, telepathy, teleporting, the ability to consume things (and if need be, people) with other orifices besides your mouth, and lastly the ability to communicate with animals. Your name was Todd Suire and you arrived at the Institute to find somewhere you could belong to a group that knew how it felt to be "different". You walk outside (having left your bags outside your room but out of anyone's way) and notice a red haired teen sitting by her self stretching but as you approach her you notice a wild scent about the girl that you recognize as a fellow canine shape-shifter. The girl hasn't noticed you so you walk closer to her until you are close enough to touch her head with your hands without her getting away if she gets scared. You place your hands on her shoulders while she's bent forward stretching her calf muscles and immobilize her to get inside her head to hold a private conversation. "Hello there, I didn;t think there would be any other shape-shifters nearby, what's your name miss?" Does she panic or try to casually get acquainted?
125.title: More than you appear to be

13.content:
You pick yourself up and grab you suitcase. A woman approaches you as you begin to lug it towards the Institute, your new home. She's tall and well built - some would say Amazonian - with pure white hair. She greets you with a quick smile.

"I had a feeling you'd arrived." She gestured upwards at the dark sky brimming with angry black clouds. "Is this your doing?"

You grin sheepishly. "Sorry. It does that when I'm in a bad mood." You focus on controlling your mutant power, and the clouds begin to vanish in seconds, as though being torn apart by an unfelt wind.

"It looks as though we may have to teach you subtlety in controlling the weather," the woman said. "But promising none-the-less. My name is Ororo, incidentally, though you can call me Storm if you wish. I will be your instructor."
13.title: Weather manipulation

131.content:
"And your instruction shall begin immediately. We can't be having a hurricane just because you're in a bad mood, can we?" Much to your surprise, she floats up off the ground and towards the Institute. "I shall see you on the roof in an hour."

---------------

It's about an hour later. You've had to stop and ask for directions a number of times, but you've eventually located the attic classroom with the sky-light taking up most of the ceiling. It's open. Poking your head out, you find it opens onto a flat section of roof and that Storm is waiting for you, sitting cross legged on the tiles. You scramble up.

"Welcome to my classroom," she says. "To begin our first lesson, we will - "
131.title: Begin training

choices: Make a friend before classes start

Find someone you whom you can steal their power and get away with it
Write a painful letter home (remember he was rejected by his family)
14.content:
Vincent is a young man coming up on his 16th year of existance, not much of big deal concidering the circumstances he faced getting here. Rejected by the family he'd do anything for, living with a few gangs then the Morlocks for a time. Until finally he made the mistake of joining the brotherhood. He was sure there were a few people at his new school that wouldn't be kind just of the fact he was once in that group.

Storm was the first to greet him, since she was now the head of the school in Xavier's 'permanent' absence. "Hello Vincent, welcome to our school. Since I know you won't be needing a tour of our grounds-" she said very subtly referring to the last time he was here in the most nonchalant manner, "I'll tell a few of our most basic rules...."

Now in his own room Vincent was happy to not hear anymore rules from Storm. Just the basic rules right? pfft, if Rogue hadn't popped in it might've stopped at 20 but no; Rogue and her friends had bombarded him with like a hundred more. Didn't help much that Vincent got fed up and snapped back with a hurting remark. Were it not for Wolverine's intervention Vincent and Rogue would've battled it off. How would a fight between two power theft mutants worked out?

....probably not in Vincent's favor. Unlike Rogue his mutation was more vampiric. He didn't have all those supernatural powers like in thost stories, but he did have a few physical and mental enhancements that made it easier for him to hunt. From 10 feet away he could spot "good" blood, people's blood told him a lot of things if he only got a single drop. Also instead of absorbing life force and power through touch he had to take their blood. It was practically a necessity because even though his body naturally produced blood it didn't produce enough sustain him on its own. He only need to "feed" every 2 days. And that was about 2 pints of blood. What made his power really unique was if he took enough blood from a mutant he could keep their powers for up to 2 days time. But for any humanoid he took blood from he could also steal their voice, appearence, etc for that amount of time too.

"I don't begin class until tomorrow what should I do till then?"
14.title: Power Theft Teen - 1st Day

choices: Approach the girl and try to talk with her
Cannon Ball right across from her
141.content:
"I don't know anyone here. I may make enemies but since I probably can't talk in class now is probably better than any to make a friend." he said outloud getting up. Since it was around late afternoon people were probably taking advantage of the cooler air outside. He slipped on some flip-flops, shorts and walked out completely forgetting the sunscreen.

On his way to the pool he spots a dark-skinned female, who unlike the other girls wore a very modest swimsuit. For some odd reason Vincent always got turned on when women wore modest clothing rather than the other way around. She didn't enter the water with the other students instead she sat at the opposite end of the pool. Her bathing suit had several shades of blue, and even if it was modestly worn she did have a certain exotic flair. The blue bathing suit had sharp flourishing designs across her midsection and the flaps that hung from her hips down. She looked like a mermaid with er black hair waving with the wind as if inviting him over.

142.content:
On hard days like these Vincent had 3 choices: sleep, create, or destroy. Today he had too much energy for the first choice, and nothing really inspired him to draw....unless he wanted to draw some obscene comedy about Rogue. "nah, I don't know enough to do anything REALLY witty." Vincent got up and went to the basement floor to train. He only been in there once and that was more of a life/death situation...maybe. The Xmen weren't like that but they could sure as Hell make it seem that way.

"Hey Beast who's training right now?" he asked walking into the control room of the VR.

"hmm? Oh nice to meet you Vincent. Rogue's down there venting a little steam." the very-built blue 'man' looked at him amused. "You wouldn't happen to be here for that same reason would you?"

"nah, I hear you guys actually train your students. I'd like to do more than suck blood and shoot bullets." he replied back. Good thing he could fake his way through anything. "Venting steam" was EXACTLY why Vincent had come here.

Two lasers cut through the air where he was as he hits the ground running, grabbing a small slab of broken building with a piece of rebar hanging on one side. Hefting it he launches it at the colossus nail the massive robot in the neck. A solid crack is heard. His eyes quickly dart to Rogue as she is running away from the action with the child in her arms.

Up above he hears two more Sentinels flying in to deal with the arrogant mutant and he smiles. The Laser bots are in partial shut down mode waiting for orders from a sentinel main unit. 15.title: Other powers

choices: Leave it for later, go to your room first
151.content:
While you look around and take in the area, you say to yourself, "not too bad."

As you put your sunglasses away, you notice a mob heading towards the gates you're standing next to. When they get close you can see some of the signs they're holding which read "Go home freaks!" and "USA, mutants not okay."

Quickly you think of your options: burn through the font door and walk right on in. However protesters have always annoyed you, even if it wasn't about mutants and you are in a mood to kick ass and take names.

Before you fully makeup your mind the door opens.

Out comes the sexy Emma frost in one of her many outfits that leave little to the imagination.

"People, this is a school; we have exams going on at the moment. Can't you do this another day?"

A protester with a megaphone replies to her, "How can you dress like a whore and clam to care about children?"

Already bored of this, you decide to finish it right now. "Hay, you with the megaphone, come here."

All of a sudden everyone looks at you as if they've only just noticed you, while you roll you eyes at their ignorance, the guy with the megaphone walks over to you.

"Listen, mate, I have to say, you are a brave guy or really stupid."

"Huh?" is his only reply.

"Lets face facts, you're protesting about a group of people who even one of them has ten times the power of an atom bomb, I mean me personally I would've killed you all right know, but hey that's just because of my unchecked anger issues. Hey, you know what would really show them you mean business, if you left now and got a petition together."

Quickly the guy walks to the front of the mob and informs them, "Okay people, we've shown them we mean business lets get out of here."

As they leave, Emma walks over to you, "You know I could of handled that just as well?"

"Yeah but I enjoy putting the fear into people before beating the shit out of them. call me Edd."

"Emma Frost, we've got a room set up for you or would you like the tour of the grounds, mansion or the basement first?"
151.title: Pyrokinesis

choices: A loud crash wakes you up
1512.content:
"If it's all the same Emma I've been traveling a fair while. You mind if we leave the tour for later."

Emma simply replies, "Fine by me." While you don't yet have full understanding of Emma yet, you get the impression that she is a little disappointed.

As she leads you to your room down an empty hallway, you can't help but notice Emma's amazing figure.

"So Edward are you able create fire or just controlling it?"

While trying to keep your anger in check, "Both, among other things."

"Hit a nerve, did I, dear?"

"You ever heard of a facility called the village?"

"No, why, what did they do?"

"They tried to make supper mutants. They believed that through the correct motivation, our powers could be much stronger than the normal level of mutants."

She stops and looks at you with a raised eyebrow.

"They tortured us, and I sent that place back to hell."

"How old were you?"

"I was seventeen at the time, almost four years ago."

"I'm sorry, I mean I knew experiments were being done on mutants, but not that young."

"Just don't call me Edward; that part of me is dead."

She looks at you for a second with a look of pain before carrying on walking. Finally you get to your room and thank Emma. After you finish unpacking you go to sleep.
1512.title: Leave it for later

15122.content:
You wake up to hear a loud crash. In an instant you're up and have fire in your hands ready to burn whatever made the noise.

After stepping out in the hallway you make your way towards to where you think you heard the crash.

You find a large hole in a wall and three guys out cold on the floor. Before you have a chance to wonder what happened, a huge man made out of steel walks through the hole.

"You must be the new addition, Piotr Nikolaievitch Rasputin. Pleased to meet you comrade, call me Colossus."

"Okay, Colossus. Hay, was it you who made this wall this hole?"

"Of course."

At that point two guys in full tactical gear come round the corner. Before they anyone can say anything, you throw two fireballs at them.

Seeing one of them dropped a pda, you pick it up.

"Piotr, you any good with these things."

"Not that good I'm afraid, but when hank gets back from his mission I'll ask him."

"Where is everyone anyway?"

"All of the other X-men are away on a mission, just Miss Frost and myself to look after school."

At that point the pda vibrates and a message appears reading " Subject bagged and tagged. Pull out. Mission complete."

Both of you hear a copter taking off outside.

"I'll go after them, Piotr, make certain the others are okay."

"You can fly like the human torch?"

"Yeah, but I have trouble hovering."

"Good luck, comrade."

With that, you fireball a window and jump out of it and go after the helicopter.

Emma opened her eyes to see Edd in a guard's outfit.

Sshe didn't know why but the look on his face scared her; he looked a perfect blend of anger, hate, and tiredness.

At that point she noticed the burnt corpse dragged to the side of the lab. It wasn't that she hadn't seen the dead body, more the fact that there was no regret on his face whatsoever.

"Emma, look at me, why were they after you. What's your power?" he asked firmly.

"Let me just get my head to stop spinning, give me a second."

"Emma, we don't have time. If I know what you can do, the better I can come up with an escape plan that might work."

"Good grief, are you always this pushy?"

"You should see me on a date." He winks at her with a grin.

At that point, a large bang is heard from the other side of the door.

"I don't mean to rush you, sweet cheeks, but what's your power?"

"I'm a psychic and can turn my body indestructible."

Edd stares at her for a second, "Your a natural double helix? No, on second thoughts doesn't matter; just go with one of them."
15122121.title: Emma frost

"Fine, I'll go with my diamond for it's easier." said a pissed of Emma.

At that point the door is blown open to reveal five soldiers full armed pointing their guns at Edd and Emma. One of the soldiers shouts, "Surrender or we will use force?"

Edd responds in a cold and deadly tone, "I've got a better deal, Run. Run for your life."

"Open fire!" all of the soldiers open fire, in a split second Edd's skin turns black like charcoal, the bullets melt in the air from the heat makes. after the soldiers see this they back away in fear.

Edd keeping his tone the same simple says "My turn."

In one motion Edd sends a sea of fire through the corridors of the complex, burning everyone in there to a crisp. Emma stands there horrified at what she's just see. Edd just walks towards the exit as if nothing is wrong.


As Edd steps outside Emma follows him.

Edd calmly "Are you talking about how I stopped the bullets or the killing people thing?"

Luckily the jeep had a full tank of gas, after about two hours of driving in silence. Emma finally decided to brake the silence.

"You did not have to kill all of them."

While keeping his eyes on the road Edd replies, "You don't get it do you?"

"The people that built that facility, were the same one's who built the village, I don't want anyone to go though what I went through, least of all you."

For the first time in a while Emma gave a warm smile, truth be told she didn't even know why herself.

"So what did you mean about double helix?"

"It was a nickname for mutants who have two powers, like how I melted the bullets before and can make and control fire."

"That's why they were after me?"

"I guess so."

"We need to find some better cloths, your still in you nightwear and I'm in a guards outfit."

Edd pulls the jeep over to the side of the road and looks over to Emma sleeping.

Softly he wakes her, "Emma, time to wake up."

As she wakes up, she lets out a sigh which reminds Edd of a cat purring.

"Problems?"

After you woke up you were introduced to all the other X-men, you hear about a room called the Danger room. While you stand in the control room with beast at the controls you watch wolverine destroy a robot army, in walks Iceman.

"So your the new guy Edward, right?

You clench your fist to keep it from landing in Bobby's face, "Listen Drake, don't go down that path nothing good is down there, you hear me?"

Drake smiled "Yeah Frost said you had a thing about that and also if I knew what what was good for me then I wouldn't call you it."

Getting more and more annoyed by him, "So you just decided to anyway?"

You take a second to think, then look over to Beast "Hank you mind if I have a go next."

Hank asks "Of course, what would you like?"

"Hay man listen I fight you but be warned, I got a lot of tricks up my sleeve." replied Bobby.

You just smile at him.
151221211211221.title: Try the danger room.

152.content:
Since a young age you have been able to malipulate the properties of all metals, leading to an array of varied and strange structures back home which you crafted from various objects and packs your parents bought for you, since one of your favourite subjects back at your old school was art and you have ambitions to sculpt metal in the future.

Even so, you haven't always been the quiet type, and when a cruel fellow student of your old school destroyed one of your seemingly 'miracle' metal projects out of spite, you angrily forgot your parent's warning to keep your powers a secret and proceeded to crush the irritating jock's car into scrap when no one was looking. It was then you realised that your powers could be a force for good or bad, and you have tried your best to be a better person ever since.

Regardless your parents felt the 'car incident' was a bad thing for you to do and soon after a wheelchair-bound man named Professor Charles Xavier contacted you and convinced them to allow you a place in his school for similar 'gifted' individuals and to learn to use their powers responsibly.

Since arriving you have been getting some uncomfortable looks, and it pains you to know why. Xavier has told you that you share a similar gift with a man named Eric Lehnsherr, better known to the world at large as the Global Mutant Terrorist Magneto, self-claimed 'Master of Magnetism' and Xavier's poplar opposite in the feelings on Mutants and Humans - whilst the Professor feels that Mutants and Homo Sapians can and should co-exist, Magneto does not share this view and so has attempted to punish humanity on many occasions through his Brotherhood of Mutants.

In short, already you've got this villainous character rep learing over you due to your particular powers. Thankfully the various teachers you meet at first - Jean Grey, a Telepath like the Professor, Scott Summers, who wears specs to protect his laser blasting eyesight (and apparently in some sort of romantical relationship with Jean, you guess), Ororo Munroe, who has extensive control over the elements like Rain and Lightning, Hank McCoy, a Blue Furrish Mutant who defies his appearance of a 'Beast' by being incredibly gifted and in charge of the Sciences at the School, and lastly Logan, a odd short fellow who has steel claws and seems quite out of place in this schooling environment, which is odd in itself.

In any case you have the first day to yourself with classes commencing tomorrow. You could either head to your dorm and meet your roommate, or prhraps explore the mansion or surrsounding grounds a little? If nothing else you must shrug off this pesky reputation this Magnus fellow has given ypu, otherwise you might as well join up in his stupid Brotherhood of Mutants...
152.title: Control Over Metal

1521.content:
You exited Professor Xavier’s study with directions on your hand. The wheelchair bound professor was okay, and you get the feeling that everyone in the school liked him a lot. Some of the students and teachers even called him Professor X. You could see why. The guy must have loved X’s. There are numerous trinkets and things shaped after the 24th alphabet. Take the Prof’s wheelchair for example.

Turning your attention to the piece of paper on your fingers, you read it closely and went towards the foyer and up through the huge staircase to the second floor, and into the west wing, where most of the dorms were concentrated.

Like the first floor, the second floor was richly paneled with smooth, dark wood which you guessed might be mahogany, along with some beautiful paintings, sculptures, and vases. You could feel some stares from the student body as you passed. Some of them were even pointing and whispering with each other. It seemed that rumors spread fast in this mansion. Some of the students gave you a wide berth while the others seemed to be more interested with you. But none of them made the move to approach you.

Sighing, you turned into another corridor and quickly found your room, which is right on the end of the corridor. You inserted the key into the door and it opened with a creak. Surprisingly, the room was clean, without any indication that it had been inhabited for a long time. You shrugged and pulled your suitcase in, closing the door with your magnetic powers.

You flopped on the bed, with your legs dangling over the edge of the mattress and just laid there for a minute. You thought on what will happen to you now that you’re living with other mutants. You sighed and went into a sitting position when the door opened.

It was...
1521.title: Head to your Rooms

choices: Show Dirk what you can do with your powers
15212.content:
It was a rather lanky guy, somewhat your age as you can't really tell. He has his thick mop of brown hair spiked up rather messily and he is staring at you in surprise. Looking at the key on his hand, you conclude that the guy must be your roommate. The guy must have realized that he has been staring rather rudely because he suddenly coughed, and closed the door with an awkward smile.

"Er, hi. I take it you're my roommate?"

You nod, extending your arm for a handshake. "Yeah. I just got here."

"Oh, a new guy!" Your roommate exclaimed with a large grin. "I'm Dietrich Bruno, but you can call me Dirk." he said, shaking your hands enthusiastically. "What are your powers then?"

To be honest, you were kinda taken aback by Dirk's enthusiasm. Though, living in a boarding school of mutants must've been rather liberating that everyone is not afraid to show each other's powers. So, taking a breath, you replied, "Well, I can control metal."

"What? Like Magneto?"

There's that name again. "Yes... like that guy." You added slowly, feeling rather annoyed. "I can bend and disperse metallic substances and stuff, though I definitely can't float. At least, not yet. It would be cool though." you sigh, recalling how you've seen that particular mutant glide so easily over the air using his metal and magnetic powers.

"Yes, yes. It would be awesome." Dirk agreed. "Oh, right. You haven't told me your name."

Oh, right. Flushing slightly in embarrassment, you said, "Brent Faulkner. Nice to meet you, Dirk."

"Likewise." Dirk grinned, plopping down to one of the beds.

"What are your powers then?" You ask, genuinely intrigued. In your life, you haven't met many mutants before, and as you are kind of living a sheltered life, it's only natural to be curious.

Dirk sported another wide grin at your question. "I'll just simply show ya." He thrust his hand outwards, to the direction of the desk on his side of the room. You watch in amazement as the drawers slid out and a stream of electronic parts came flying out, orbiting around Dirk's outstretched hand, slowly assembling themselves together as wires attached themselves to circuitry boards, metals shifts, buttons assembled themselves, gears whirled. It's like watching a rather odd dance. The next second, a fully assembled Gameboy was lying on Dirk's hand, beeping cheerfully.

"Whoa..."

"Yep. Technopath at your service." Said Dirk, seemingly pleased with himself. "I can build a lot of things, but nothing major just yet. Though, I've experimented with a few things, like an EMP emitter and the like." he trailed off, humming thoughtfully. "Say, can you show me what you can do with your powers?"

You thought about it. Should you show Dirk your powers? Or shouldn't you and tell him to wait first?
15212.title: Your roommate

choices: Nope.  I'm making my own storyline here.
1531.content: Fire. It is a tricky thing. For one thing, a wildfire is hard to control. Try having one raging inside you trying to escape. You are Zenn. You are a 14 year old boy who fears his powers due to them nearly killing your best friend. Because of this you fear to connect to people, because they might get hurt. Despite this you are a nice person who would never hurt anyone innocent of hurting someone.
